title: Very simple change to give Annie "Windows of Power" which goes with Riot's recent design philosophy
body:
In almost all of their new designs, Riot has been emphasizing "windows of power" to allow for counterplay. The two biggest examples are the Ashe and Ryze reworks, which use a stacking system to build up stacks, then react quickly to achieve a window of power or risk losing the stacks. We could do the same with Annie with one simple change: **make her stun charges fall after some time of not casting a damaging ability**.

Currently, Annie can charge her stun and zone you kinda "forever"; or as much as she wants to. This applies to both mid lane and bottom lane Annie. If, however, her stacks would drop off if not used, she could only zone you for only as long as her passive charges remain. And when they fall off, it gives you a window of opportunity to play more aggressive against her without risking being instagibed.

The problem with 'windows of power' is that to create the window, you need to compensate by increasing the strength during the window. Do you really want a burst mage like Annie to have a 'window of power' like Ryze and Ashe? Yes, they made them slightly harder to play but increased their damage tremendously. 

Ryze went from 'weak early, strong late' to 'strong when passive is up, weak when down'. We all saw the permasnare at level 9 in patch 5.11. Now its not as bad, but without flash you arent running away.

Ashe went from 'utility ADC' to 'utility adc with hypercarry damage'. Before, if you say that she had 55/100 attacks crit with an IE and PD, she would statistically do 182.5% damage over 100 attacks. Now its 192.5% damage with the same items, not including her Q which does a bonus 135% AD damage per auto during her 'window of power'.

Imagine a similar buff to Annie. You might not be able to hold the stun, but when its up she bursts you 100-0 without tibbers. Is that something you want?

Annie already has the great damage that Ryze and Ashe received, and doesn't need more. She did receive buffs to her scalings and ultimate cooldown not too long ago.

Also, I don't think the window of power I'm suggesting is as hugely impactful as Ashe's or Ryze's. She's just going to lose her stun stacks if she doesn't use it, then stack it up back quickly with a QWE rotation, since she only needs 4 stacks. It won't have a dramatic impact on her play pattern; it's just to give her opponents a bit bigger breathing room.

Therein lies the problem, and makes it so your argument wont get any consideration. Ryze and Ashe werent weak before, but were given stacking mechanicsms to track - it makes it harder to play, more easily identifiable to play against, and gives periods of exploitable weakness. All youre doing is proposing a nerf. 

Think of it this way: Ryze has a 4 second non-targeted Q, with a passive 30% CDR at rank 3 of ult. Include 5% from masterieis, and he gets 35% CDR for free. He has 10 seconds to charge up 5 stacks, which he can do with his 2.6 second Q. Combine that with his passive that refreshes his Q whenever he uses it, and he can use his Q purely to stack his passive and not worry about not having it later for damage. 

If you do something similar to Annie, she needs to use her 2 non targeted abilities - her W on a 8 second cooldown, E on a 10. She has no refresh in her kit. Meaning that in order to get a tibbers stun, you have to already be deep into a fight - youre stuck either using 2 of her abilities to no effect to get a stun, or youre stuck not having a stun for the majority of the fight on a 625 range mage. She shouldnt have to worry about not doing damage to get in her 'window'. No other stacking champion does - Ryze and Vlad have extremely low cooldowns, and Ashe applies her stacks on every ability and autoattack. Gnar has different strengths in his forms, but doesnt ever lose power.

Big problem with her Identity. Her engage with Flash Tibbers is all she's used for. You can't really nerf that without completely gutting her Identity. (of coarse it's her identity that everyone hates.) Also the Stun on her passive is her only CC in her entire kit. Nerfing that would be as problematic for a mage's kit. If this wasn't the case, Veigar would not be in as a terrible position as he is now. Yet in Annie's case, it's more balanceable cause it's her ultimate ability. 

In all honesty, I don't actually think her Flash engage is that big of a problem. Cause if it was, We would have just as much problem with {{champion:37}} Flash Crescendo, {{champion:32}} Flash Curse of the sad mummy, {{champion:3}} flash Idol of Duran, or any number of champs that have High, lock down ultimates. Gallio and Amumu, arguably have a harder time cause theirs are more close burst and their melee, But the fact that they usually build tanky makes this some what moot. And the different between Annie and Sona is that Sona is basically confined to the support role. 

So I would deduced that the only reason why her Stun is problematic is that it's paired with high Damage and High scaling. Is that really a good reason to butcher the only thing going for her in her kit. I'd think it would be more appropriate to just nerf the damage of the ultimate, if the ultimate is too powerful by itself. (well, itself + the stun)

Cause if you have to cast your Q or W in defense. You lose it, and would have to stack it up again. 

Lastly, Annie is still a staple pick in the LCS as a support. They seem to think that it's actually balanced and won't nerf that. The only way to nerf Annie without nerfing her Support abilities is to attack her AP ratios.

I do get your point. But you shouldn't compare her to Ryze or Ashe. Their windows of power have a much more dramatic impact, and are centric to their damage output. My suggestion for Annie is just to encourage her to use the stun more often. If she loses it, she can stack it back up really quickly with one spell rotation, while giving her opponent a bot of a breathing room.

Also, Annie's cooldowns are not long. In lane, her Q has a 4 second cooldown, which drops to 2 seconds if she last-hits with it. Her other spells do a have a longer cooldown, but keep in mind she only needs 4 stacks to get her stun anyway.

If. If I shouldn't compare her to Ryze and Ashe then why did you bring them up as examples for your idea?

But the idea doesn't work, and comparing her to them explains why it works on them but not Annie.

But in fairness without her stun, what exactly keeps other mid laners from jumping her? Nothing.

Her entire identity and kit is setup around her passive stun, and this somewhat long window of opportunity is a colossal weakness for it, especially charging it, if it can only be up for a limited time this requires her to constantly use her abilities and waste mana, if she wants it up for a fight she needs something to hit in order to proc it up quickly enough, and because of this change being limited she is even more vulnerable with her stun for a bit because she has to wait for her cooldowns before she can even use her combo + stun.

Do you see where this is failing?

A reasonable nerf to Annie assuming she actually needed one, would be making her need 1 more charge to stun, or lowering it's duration. But people want to see her gutted then actually balancing her properly.
